## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to assist you in understanding Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I'm interested in learning more about Verus DeFi. Can you tell me about Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies, and how they work?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies are a type of currency that is backed by one or more asset currencies, with a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. These currencies are part of the Verus DeFi protocol, which ensures that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers. Would you like me to explain more about how Verus DeFi addresses MEV and front-running?

**User:**
Yes, that would be great. How does the Verus DeFi protocol address the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This prevents miners from exploiting price differences across different liquidity pools and ensures a fair and transparent conversion process. It's an innovative solution that creates a more equitable and secure DeFi environment. Do you have any other questions about Verus DeFi?

**User:**
Actually, I do. What is the significance of simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches allow for the creation of a new blockchain and a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool at the same time. This enables the new blockchain to have its own liquidity pool, with fees generated from cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool earned on the new blockchain, without any rent going back to the Verus blockchain. It's a game-changer for blockchain creation and liquidity pool management. Do you have any questions about crowdfunding currency launches in Verus?

**User:**
Yes, I do. How do blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches work in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches allow for the creation of new currencies with minimum participation or automatic refunds. Creators can set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on chain. If the minimums are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically get a refund of all their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. It's a flexible and user-friendly way to launch new currencies and bring innovation to the blockchain space. Do you have any more questions about Verus or Verus DeFi?
What are Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies, and how do they work?

Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies are a type of currency that is backed by one or more asset currencies, with a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. These currencies are part of the Verus DeFi protocol, which ensures that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers.

ne Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols. ## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity. ## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge) - Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well. ## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale** - The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to setup with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private netwo
